It is similar in many ways to R Markdown (which isnt going away, dont worry!), except that it doesnt require R, supports more languages, and combines the functionality of many R Markdown packages (e.g., xaringan, bookdown). ## Ventajas de Quarto - [en StackOverfow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/72089640/what-are-the-benefits-of-using-quarto-over-rmarkdown) ## Blog en 100 segundos ## Web Docente ### Creaci贸n ### Tuneado ### Creaci贸n de posts ### Publicaci贸n
